name: Research
text: Use these online libraries to research for your projects.

items.name: ProQuest
items.text: The ProQuest Research Library includes more than 4,700 titles.

items.name: The Library of Congress
items.text: The largest library in the world, with millions of books, recordings, photographs, newspapers, maps and manuscripts in its collections. The Library is the main research arm of the U.S. Congress and the home of the U.S Copyright Office.

items.name: Smithsonian
items.text: The world’s largest museum, education, and research complex. The website is a curation of featured collections, stories, and digital records of Art & Design, History & Culture, and Science & Nature.

items.name: Internet Archive
items.text: A non-profit library of millions of free books, movies, software, music, websites, and more.

items.name: NARA
items.text: The National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) is the nation's record keeper.

items.name: Local Library
items.text: Students are encouraged to access the resources available at their local public library.

items.name: OATD
items.text: The Open Access Theses and Dissertations includes over 4.5 million theses and disserations from over 1,100 colleges.

items.name: ThesisCommons
items.text: Open repository for theses and dissertations from the Open Science Foundation.

name: eBooks
text: Websites that offer free digital textbooks, reference materials and online learning resources

items.name: Bookboon
items.text: Free access to hundreds of free textbooks written by university professors.

items.name: OpenStax
items.text: Free high-quality peer-reviewed, openly licensed textbooks/

items.name: Planet eBook
items.text: Free classic literature Ebooks in multi-formats for reading across all devices.

items.name: Open Textbook Library
items.text: A growing catalog of free, peer-reviewed, and openly licensed textbooks.

items.name: O'Reilly Open Books Project
items.text: Features computer and technology related books

items.name: IntechOpen
items.text: Includes hundreds of free open access books in the fields of science, technology, and medicine.

name: Art & Design
text: Websites and other online resources that offer images and art for students.

items.name: MMA Heilbrunn
items.text: An outstanding Timeline of Art History, which can be searched by region, time, and themes.

items.name: The Getty Conservation Institute
items.text: The Getty Conservation Institute offers great insight into the methods of producing and conserving art.

items.name: Google Art Project
items.text: Google Art Project offers virtual tours of galleries and museums around the world.

items.name: 360 Cities
items.text: 360 Cities is a collection of virtual tours of select cities and art monuments.

items.name: SFMoMA Video Archive
items.text: Offers a wonderful collection of historic videos featuring everything from Van Gogh painting in his garden to the debate over Richard Serra’s Tilted Arc in NYC.

items.name: The Library of Congress Digital Collections
items.text: The Library of Congress Digital Collections is a comprehensive site featuring the Library of Congress’ digital collections and archive.

items.name: Web Gallery of Art
items.text: Web Gallery of Art is an excellent database of images and artist bios (majority of focus: medieval era to 19th century).

items.name: PBS Art 21
items.text: A collection of video clips and full episodes featuring 21st century artists. Searchable by artist and theme.

name: Medical Resources
text: A list of professional research websites for medical students.

items.name: Journal of the American Medical Association
items.text: A vast collection of medical research and resources.

items.name: New England Journal of Medicine
items.text: A source for research, reviews, medical cases, and articles.

items.name: Web MD
items.text: News, health tips, research, and articles on all things medical with content created by doctors and those in the medical profession.

items.name: The San Diego Zoo
items.text: A vast collection of medical research and resources.

items.name: 12 Banksy Murals
items.text: A source for research, reviews, medical cases, and articles.

items.name: NASA
items.text: News, health tips, research, and articles on all things medical with content created by doctors and those in the medical profession.

items.name: Virtual Tour of the Eisenhower Executive Office Building
items.text: News, health tips, research, and articles on all things medical with content created by doctors and those in the medical profession.
